original: so tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ; tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī
analyzed: saḥ tatas cutaḥ amutra udapādi tatra apāsim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgottaḥ eva vaṇṇo evam āhāraḥ eva sukha dukkha ppaṭisavedī
translated: and passing away from there, I reappeared elsewhere; and there too I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term;🔽and passing away from there, I reappeared here.’

original: evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto idhūpapannoti; iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ🔽pubbenivāsaṁ anussareyyan’ti,
analyzed: evam āyu pariyantaḥ saḥ tatas cutaḥ idhu upapanno ti iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihita  pubbenivāsam anussareyyanti
translated: ‘Thus with their aspects and particulars I can recollect my manifold past abodes,’

translated: you will attain the ability to witness any aspect therein, with regard to each component of mind and body.

analyzed: saḥ tva vaccha yāvat eva ākaṅkhissasi  dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passeyyam cavamāne upapajjamāne

translated: you will attain the ability to witness any aspect therein, with regard to each component of mind and body.🔽“So, Vaccha, to the extent that you may wish:🔽‘By realising for myself with direct knowledge, I will here and now enter upon and abid in the deliverance of mind and deliverance by wisdom that are taintless with the destruction of the taints,’

original: bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannā; ime vā pana bhonto
analyzed: bhedāḥ param maraṇāḥ apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapannāḥ ime vā pana bhontaḥ
translated: you will attain the ability to witness any aspect therein, with regard to each component of mind and body.

analyzed: sattā kāya su caritena samannāgatā vacī su caritena samannāgatā manaḥ su caritena samannāgatā  ariyānaṃ an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā te kāyassa bhedā para  maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ati iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena
translated: beings who have done good deeds by way of body, speech, and mind,🔽who have not reviled noble ones, who have right view and undertaken right action, will, on the break-up of the body, after death,

translated: I would see beings passing away and re-appearing, and I would understand how beings pass on according to their actions.’🔽you will attain the ability to witness any aspect therein, there being a suitable basis.🔽“You will attain the ability to witness any aspect therein, there being a suitable basis.

original: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṁ pāpuṇissasi, sati satiāyatane”ti.
analyzed: tatra tatra iva sakkhibhabbatam pāpuṇissasi sati sati āyatane iti
translated: “You will attain the ability to witness any aspect therein, there being a suitable basis.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā vacchagotto bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.🔽Atha kho āyasmā vacchagotto eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto nacirasseva—yassatthāya🔽kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā vacchagottaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi  atha kho āyasmā vaccha gottaḥ ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ ātāpī pahitattaḥ viharantaḥ nacira ssevayassatthāya  kula puttā sammad eva agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajanti tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosāna
translated: After rejoicing in and approving of the Buddha’s words, he got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

original: diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
analyzed: diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: Not long after his departure, he directly knew,

original: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: as it really is, “Birth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”

original: Aññataro kho panāyasmā vacchagotto arahataṁ ahosi.🔽Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ dassanāya gacchanti.
analyzed: aññataraḥ kho pana ayasman vaccha gotto arahatam ahosi  tena kho pana samayena sambahulāḥ bhikkhū bhagavantam dassanāya gacchanti
translated: And Venerable Vacchagotta became another one of the perfected ones.🔽On one occasion a number of monks were going to see the Buddha.🔽Vacchagotta saw them coming

original: Addasā kho āyasmā vacchagotto te bhikkhū dūratova āgacchante.
analyzed: addasā kho āyasmā vacchagotto te bhikkhū dūratas va āgacchante
translated: and said to them,

original: Disvāna yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etadavoca:
analyzed: disvāna yena te bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: and after approaching them, he said this to those monks:

original: “handa kahaṁ pana tumhe āyasmanto gacchathā”ti?
analyzed: handa kaham pana tumhe āyasmantaḥ gacchatha ati
translated: When he saw them, he went up to them and said to them, “Where are you going, Venerables?”

original: “Bhagavantaṁ kho mayaṁ, āvuso, dassanāya gacchāmā”ti.
analyzed: bhagavantam kho mayaḥ āvuso dassanāya gacchāma ati
translated: “We’re going to see the Buddha.”

original: “Tenahāyasmanto mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vandatha, evañca vadetha:
analyzed: tena ha ayasmantaḥ mama vacanena bhagavataḥ pāde sirasā vandatha evañca vadetha
translated: “Then, in my name, bow down in respect with your head at the Buddha’s feet. Say to him:

original: ‘vacchagotto, bhante, bhikkhu bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, evañca vadeti—
analyzed: vaccha gottaḥ bhante bhikkhu bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati evam ca vadeti
translated: ‘Venerable Sir, the monk Vacchagotta bows down in respect with his head at your feet

original: pariciṇṇo me bhagavā, pariciṇṇo me sugato’”ti.
analyzed: pariciṇṇaḥ me bhagavā pariciṇṇaḥ me sugataḥ iti
translated: and says that he has served the Buddha and the Sangha well.’”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato vacchagottassa paccassosuṁ.🔽Atha kho te bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: evam āvuso ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmataḥ vaccha gottassa  atha kho te bhikkhū yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu ekamantam nisinnāḥ kho te bhikkhū bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: “Yes, Venerable,” they replied.🔽They then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “āyasmā, bhante, vacchagotto bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, evañca vadeti:
analyzed: bhante vacchagottaḥ bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati evam ca vada iti
translated: and said, “Venerable Sir, the monk Vacchagotta bows down in respect with his head at your feet and says that he has served the Buddha and the Sangha well.”

original: ‘pariciṇṇo me bhagavā, pariciṇṇo me sugato’”ti.
analyzed: pariciṇṇaḥ me bhagavā pariciṇṇaḥ me sugataḥ iti
translated: ‘I’ve attended on the Buddha, I’ve attended on the Buddha’s Teaching.’”

original: “Pubbeva me, bhikkhave, vacchagotto bhikkhu cetasā ceto paricca vidito:
analyzed: pubbā iva me bhikkhave vaccha gottaḥ bhikkhu cetasā cetaḥ paricca viditaḥ
translated: “Before this, monks, I knew the monk Vacchagotta by having read his mind:

original: ‘tevijjo vacchagotto bhikkhu mahiddhiko mahānubhāvo’ti.
analyzed: tevijjaḥ vaccha gottaḥ bhikkhu mahiddhikaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ ti
translated: ‘He’s a perfected one with great supernormal powers, great and mighty powers.’

original: Devatāpi me etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ:
analyzed: devatā api me etam attham ārocesu
translated: And deities also told me:

original: ‘tevijjo, bhante, vacchagotto bhikkhu mahiddhiko mahānubhāvo’”ti.
analyzed: tevijjaḥ bhante vaccha gottaḥ bhikkhu mahiddhikaḥ mahā anubhāvaḥ ti
translated: ‘Sir, the monk Vacchagotta is a perfected one with great supernormal powers, great and mighty powers.’”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: That is what the Buddha said.

original: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
analyzed: attamanāḥ te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandunti
translated: And after he had spoken, the Holy One got up from his seat and entered his dwelling.

original: Mahāvacchasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: mahāvaccha suttam niṭṭhitam tatiya
translated: The third section for recitation on the Great One is finished.
